member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes
member.devdoc: Specifies what kind of acknowledgment to get after sending a message.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes.Secure
member.devdoc: Requests secure authentication. When this flag is set, the WinNT provider uses NT LAN Manager (NTLM) to authenticate the client. Active Directory will use Kerberos, and possibly NTLM, to authenticate the client.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes.Encryption
member.devdoc: Forces ADSI to use encryption for data exchange over the network.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes.SecureSocketsLayer
member.devdoc: Encrypts the channel with SSL. Data will be encrypted using SSL. Active Directory requires that the Certificate Server be installed to support SSL encryption.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes.ReadonlyServer
member.devdoc: For a WinNT provider, ADSI tries to connect to a primary domain controller or a backup domain controller. For Active Directory, this flag indicates that a writeable server is not required for a serverless binding.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes.Anonymous
member.devdoc: Request no authentication. The providers may attempt to bind client, as an anonymous user, to the targeted object. The WinNT provider does not support this flag. Active Directory establishes a connection between the client and the targeted object, but will not perform any authentication. Setting this flag amounts to requesting an anonymous binding, which means "Everyone" as the security context.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes.FastBind
member.devdoc: When this flag is set, ADSI will not attempt to query the objectClass property and thus will only expose the base interfaces supported by all ADSI objects instead of the full object support.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes.Signing
member.devdoc: Verifies data integrity to ensure the data received is the same as the data sent. The Secure flag must be set also in order to use the signing.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes.Sealing
member.devdoc: Encrypts data using Kerberos. The Secure flag must be set also in order to use the sealing.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes.Delegation
member.devdoc: Enables ADSI to delegate the user's security context, which is necessary for moving objects across domains.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes.ServerBind
member.devdoc: Specify this flag when using the LDAP provider if your ADsPath includes a server name. Do not use this flag for paths that include a domain name or for serverless paths.

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.DereferenceAlias
member.devdoc: Specifies the behavior in which aliases are dereferenced.

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntries
member.devdoc: Contains the children (child entries) of an entry in the Active Directory.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntries.SchemaFilter
member.devdoc: Gets the schemas that specify which children are shown.

member.name: M:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntries.Add(System.String,System.String)
member.devdoc: Creates a request to create a new entry in the container.

member.name: M:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntries.Find(System.String)
member.devdoc: Returns the child with the given name.

member.name: M:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntries.Find(System.String,System.String)
member.devdoc: Returns the child with the given name and of the given type.

member.name: M:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntries.Remove(System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry)
member.devdoc: Deletes a child from this collection.

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntries.ChildEnumerator
member.devdoc: Supports a simple ForEach-style iteration over a collection and defines enumerators, size, and synchronization methods.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntries.ChildEnumerator.Current
member.devdoc: Gets the current element in the collection.

member.name: M:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntries.ChildEnumerator.MoveNext
member.devdoc: Advances the enumerator to the next element of the collection and returns a Boolean value indicating whether a valid element is available.

member.name: M:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntries.ChildEnumerator.Reset
member.devdoc: Resets the enumerator back to its initial position before the first element in the collection.

member.devdoc: Saves any changes to the entry in the directory store.

member.devdoc: Moves this entry to the given parent.

member.devdoc: Loads the property values for this directory entry into the property cache.

member.devdoc: Changes the name of this entry.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.CacheResults
member.devdoc: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the result should be cached on the client machine.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.ClientTimeout
member.devdoc: Gets or sets the maximum amount of time that the client waits for the server to return results. If the server does not respond within this time, the search is aborted, and no results are returned.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.PropertyNamesOnly
member.devdoc: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the search should retrieve only the names of requested properties or the names and values of requested properties.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.Filter
member.devdoc: Gets or sets the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) filter string format.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.PageSize
member.devdoc: Gets or sets the page size in a paged search.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.PropertiesToLoad
member.devdoc: Gets the set of properties retrieved during the search. By default, the and properties are retrieved.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.ReferralChasing
member.devdoc: Gets or sets how referrals are chased.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.SearchScope
member.devdoc: Gets or sets the scope of the search that should be observed by the server.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.ServerPageTimeLimit
member.devdoc: Gets or sets the time limit that the server should observe to search a page of results (as opposed to the time limit for the entire search).

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.ServerTimeLimit
member.devdoc: Gets or sets the maximum amount of time the server spends searching. If the time limit is reached, only entries found up to that point will be returned.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.SizeLimit
member.devdoc: Gets or sets the maximum number of objects that the server should return in a search.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.SearchRoot
member.devdoc: Gets or sets the node in the Active Directory hierarchy at which the search will start.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.Sort
member.devdoc: Gets the property on which the results should be sorted.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.Asynchronous
member.devdoc: Gets or sets a value indicating whether searches should be carried out in an asynchronous way.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.Tombstone
member.devdoc: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the search should also return deleted objects that match the search filter.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.AttributeScopeQuery
member.devdoc: Gets or sets an attribute name to indicate that an attribute-scoped query search should be performed.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.DerefAlias
member.devdoc: Gets or sets a value to indicate how the aliases of found objects are to be resolved.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.SecurityMasks
member.devdoc: Gets or sets a value to indicate the search should return security access information for the specified attributes.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.ExtendedDN
member.devdoc: Gets or sets a value to return extended DNs according to the requested format.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.DirectorySynchronization
member.devdoc: Gets or sets a value to indicate a directory synchronization search, which returns all changes since a specified state.

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.VirtualListView
member.devdoc: Gets or sets a value to indicate the search should use the LDAP virtual list view (VLV) control.

member.name: M:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.FindOne
member.devdoc: Executes the search and returns only the first entry that is found.

member.name: M:System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher.FindAll
member.devdoc: Executes the search and returns a collection of the entries that are found.

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.ReferralChasingOption
member.devdoc: Specifies if and how referral chasing is pursued.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ReferralChasingOption.None
member.devdoc: Never chase the referred-to server. Setting this option prevents a client from contacting other servers in a referral process.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ReferralChasingOption.Subordinate
member.devdoc: Chase only subordinate referrals which are a subordinate naming context in a directory tree. The ADSI LDAP provider always turns off this flag for paged searches.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ReferralChasingOption.External
member.devdoc: Chase external referrals.

member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.ReferralChasingOption.All
member.devdoc: Chase referrals of either the subordinate or external type.
